Variable: Medicaid and Originally Disabled Interactions with Age and Sex

Disease Group: Lung, Upper Digestive Tract, and Other Severe Cancers
Lymphatic, Head and Neck, Brain, and Other Major Cancers
Breast, Prostate, Colorectal and Other Cancers and Tumors
Diabetes with Renal or Peripheral Circulatory Manifestation (1)
Diabetes with Neurologic or Other Specified Manifestation (1)
Diabetes with Ophthalmologic or Unspecified Manifestation (1)
Rheumatoid Arthritis and Inflammatory Connective Tissue Disease
Major Depressive, Bipolar, and Paranoid Disorders
Unstable Angina and Other Acute Ischemic Heart Disease
Cerebral Palsy and Other Paralytic Syndromes (3)
Proliferative Diabetic Retinopathy and Vitreous Hemorrhage
Chronic Ulcer of Skin, Except Decubitus
Vertebral Fractures without Spinal Cord Injury
Major Complications of Medical Care and Trauma
Artificial Openings for Feeding or Elimination
Amputation Status, Lower Limb / Amputation Complications

Variable: (1) Includes Type I or Type II Diabetes Mellitus.

(2) Beneficiaries with the three-way interaction RF*CHF*DM are excluded from the two-way interactions DM*CHF and RF*CHF. Thus, the three-way interaction term RF*CHF*DM is not additive to the two-way interaction terms DM*CHF and RF*CHF. Rather, it is hierarchical to, and excludes these interaction terms. A beneficiary with all three conditions is not "credited" with the two-way interactions. All other interaction terms are additive.
(3) HCC or disease interaction excluded from institutional model because estimated coefficient less than 0 or t-statistic less than 1.0.
The 2007 denominator of $7,463.14 used to calculate both the community and institutional factors is the national predicted average annual cost under the model.
COPD is chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (HCC 108).
SOURCE:  RTI International analysis of 2004/2005 Medicare 5% sample.
SOURCE:  RTI International analysis of 2004/2005 Medicare 100% institutional sample.
